in the city

If there's a future in my hands some navigation to be planned over this strange and simple nest by the ocean Bodies stacked above the earth we are a nation giving birth to the first machine alive in the city May the sun still rise for us all in the city

Every day begin the same Let the rage step out of place in this strange and simple space by the ocean If I am deaf then save your breath If I am blind don't waste your time These illusions are my pride in the city May the sun still rise for us all in the city

stolen cars and ego boosting Real good news but more confusion Bank of America my favorite parody they suck so bad they must need some charity

When the minutes turn to years and the war chiefs come to peace I won't be lying face down in the city May the sun still rise for us all in the city

By Krister Axel on 11/23 1999 at 16_59 in Poetry
